strategy: Apply a neural network with deep architecture (e.g., multi-layer perceptron) using a combination of normalized continuous features and one-hot encoded categorical variables. Introduce dropout layers to prevent overfitting, use batch normalization to stabilize training, and employ a learning rate scheduler to adaptively adjust training dynamics. Train using k-fold cross-validation with a validation loss threshold to detect overfitting. This approach captures high-order interactions and non-linear relationships that traditional tree-based models may miss, potentially improving R2 by leveraging global pattern learning from large feature spaces.
